UnableToApplyGlamourPlatesHere: Glamour plates cannot be applied in this area.
Markers.AetherCurrents.Name: Aether Currents
Markers.AetherCurrents.Description: Shows world markers for any nearby Aether Currents in the current zone.
Markers.PartyMembers.Name: Party Members
Markers.PartyMembers.Description: Shows world markers for your party members that are far away from you but in the same map.
Markers.PartyMembers.Config.ShowIcon.Des: Whether to show the party member icons on the world markers.
Markers.PartyMembers.Config.ShowName.Des: Whether to show the party member names on the world markers.
Markers.PartyMembers.Config.IconType.Des: The type of icon that is used on the world marker. Only applicable if 'Show party member icons' is enabled.
Markers.EurekaCoffers.Name: Eureka Bunny Coffers
Markers.EurekaCoffers.Description: Shows world markers for the Bunny Coffers in the Eureka zones after you've used the Lucky Carrot item.
Markers.EurekaCoffers.EnableMapMarkers.N: Enable map markers for detected coffers
Markers.EurekaCoffers.EnableMapMarkers.D: Adds map markers for detected Eureka Bunny Coffer locations. Note that this feature is unavailable if the Eureka Linker plugin is also installed and enabled, since it also provides similar functionality.
Markers.Fate.Name: FATE Markers
Markers.Fate.Description: Shows world markers for the active FATEs in the current zone.
Markers.Flag.Name: Flag Marker
Markers.Flag.Description: Shows a world marker for the placed flag in the current zone.
Markers.GatheringNodes.Name: Gathering Node Markers
Markers.GatheringNodes.Description: Shows world markers for the active gathering nodes around you.
Markers.GatheringNodes.ShowContents.Name: Show node contents
Markers.GatheringNodes.ShowContents.Desc: Shows the contents of the gathering nodes on the markers.
Markers.Hunt.Name: Hunt Markers
Markers.Hunt.Description: Shows world markers for the C/B/A/S/SS-rank mobs in the current zone.
Markers.Quest.Name: Quest Objective Markers
Markers.Quest.Description: Shows world markers for objectives of active quests in the current zone.
Markers.TreasureCoffer.Name: Treasure Coffer Markers
Markers.TreasureCoffer.Description: Shows world markers for the treasure coffers that are near you.
Markers.TripleTriad.Name: Triple Triad Card Markers
Markers.TripleTriad.Description: Shows world markers for unobtained Triple Triad cards in the current zone.
Markers.TripleTriad.ShowLockedCards.Name: Show locked cards
Markers.TripleTriad.ShowLockedCards.Desc: Shows markers for cards that are locked behind incomplete quests or other requirements.
Markers.Vista.Name: Sightseeing Log Markers
Markers.Vista.Description: Shows world markers for the sightseeing log vistas in the current zone that are not yet completed.
Markers.Waymark.Name: Waymark Markers
Markers.Waymark.Description: Shows world markers for the placed waymarks in the current zone.
Settings.Window.Title: Umbra Settings
Settings.AppearanceModule.Name: Appearance
Settings.AppearanceModule.Fonts.Name: Font Configuration
Settings.AppearanceModule.Fonts.Descript: Customize the fonts used by Umbra.
The default font that is used for most texts.
Settings.AppearanceModule.Fonts.Monospac: The monospace font is used for texts that require fixed-width characters, such as the clock.
Settings.AppearanceModule.Fonts.Emphasis: The emphasis font is typically used for decorative texts in some toolbar widgets
Settings.AppearanceModule.PopupAppearanc: Customize the general appearance of popup menus.
Adds a soft shadow around the popup menus to make them stand out more. It is recommended to disable this setting if you're using transparent popups.
Forces widget popups to be displayed as floating windows rather than being attached to the toolbar. It is recommended to enable this setting if you're using a transparent toolbar.
The currently active color profile. Your active profile is: {0}
A unique name to describe a new color profile. Use the create button to create a new profile with the given name. The new profile will be based on the currently active profile.
Allow the imported profile to overwrite the an existing profile with the same name.
Create a new profile or pick a non built-in profile to customize the colors.
You can now paste the color profile of "{0}" into a text file or share it with others.
Settings.AppearanceModule.ImportError.In: Invalid color profile format. The text in your clipboard is not a valid color profile for Umbra.
Settings.AppearanceModule.ImportError.No: No color profile found in the imported data. The text in your clipboard does not contain a color profile for Umbra.
Settings.AppearanceModule.ImportError.Du: A color profile with the same name already exists. Please choose a different name in the "New profile name" field or enable the overwrite option.
Settings.MarkersModule.Name: World Markers
Settings.MarkersModule.Config.Enabled.Na: Show markers of this type in the game world
Settings.MarkersModule.Config.ShowOnComp: Show direction indicator when out of view
Settings.MarkersModule.Config.FadeDistan: The distance in yalms between your character and the marker at which it fades out.
Settings.MarkersModule.Config.FadeAttenu: An added range to the configured fade distance from which the marker will start to fade out.
Settings.WidgetsModule.Name: Toolbar Widgets
Settings.WidgetsModule.DeleteWidget: Hold the shift-key and click to remove this widget and its instance settings. This operation cannot be undone.
Settings.WidgetsModule.EditWidget: Edit instance settings of this widget
Settings.WidgetsModule.MoveUp: Move this widget up. Hold control to move to the top.
Settings.WidgetsModule.MoveDown: Move this widget down. Hold control to move to the bottom.
Settings.WidgetsModule.MoveToLeft: Move this widget to the left side
Settings.WidgetsModule.MoveToCenter: Move this widget to the center
Settings.WidgetsModule.MoveToRight: Move this widget to the right side
Settings.WidgetsModule.CopyWidget: Create a copy of this widget and its instance settings.
Settings.ProfilesModule.Name: Config Profiles
Settings.ProfilesModule.ActiveProfile.De: The currently active profile. Changes to the settings will be saved to this profile. The active profile is associated with the current character and will be loaded automatically when you log in. Some settings may require a plugin reload to take effect.
Settings.ProfilesModule.CreateProfile.De: Creates a new profile with the given name. The name must be unique and must not contain any non-alphanumeric characters. The current settings will be copied over to the newly created profile. Some settings may require a plugin reload to take effect.
Settings.ProfilesModule.CopyProfile.Name: Copy profile
Settings.ProfilesModule.CopyProfile.Desc: Copies all settings from the selected profile to the active profile. This includes every Umbra-related setting, including but not limited to: General settings, Toolbar widgets, Saved appearances (including themes). Some settings may require a plugin reload to take effect.
Settings.ProfilesModule.DeleteProfile.De: Deletes the selected profile and all its associated settings. The default profile cannot be deleted. This operation cannot be undone. Deleting the currently active profile will revert the active profile back to the default one.
Settings.ProfilesModule.ActiveProfile.Ex: You can now paste the profile data into a text file or share it with others.
Settings.AddWidgetWindow.Title: Add Widget
Settings.AddWidgetWindow.AddButtonToolti: Hold SHIFT to keep this window open to rapidly add more widget instances.
Settings.PluginsModule.Title: Plugins
Settings.PluginsModule.Description: This section allows you to add custom plugins to Umbra that provide additional toolbar widgets or world markers for you to use. Custom plugins come in the form of DLL files that you can add below. Please make sure to only load plugins from sources that you trust.
Settings.PluginsModule.IsDisposed: This plugin has been disposed. Please restart Umbra.
Settings.PluginsModule.NotLoaded: Please restart Umbra to load this plugin.
Settings.PluginsModule.PluginsChanged: The plugin list has changed. Please restart Umbra to apply the changes.
CVAR.Sound.Enabled.Name: Enable sound effects
CVAR.Sound.Enabled.Description: Whether to play sound effects for certain actions, such as opening a widget popup.
CVAR.Sound.OpenPopupId.Name: Open popup sound
CVAR.Sound.OpenPopupId.Description: The sound effect that is played when a widget popup is opened.
CVAR.Sound.ClosePopupId.Name: Close popup sound
CVAR.Sound.ClosePopupId.Description: The sound effect that is played when a widget popup is closed.
CVAR.Sound.OpenWindowId.Name: Open window sound
CVAR.Sound.OpenWindowId.Description: The sound effect that is played when a window is opened.
CVAR.Sound.CloseWindowId.Name: Close window sound
CVAR.Sound.CloseWindowId.Description: The sound effect that is played when a window is closed.
CVAR.Markers.Compass.Enabled.Name: Enable Compass
CVAR.Markers.Compass.Enabled.Description: Whether to show the compass that indicates the direction of markers that are currently out of view.
CVAR.Markers.Compass.Radius.Name: Compass Radius
CVAR.Markers.Compass.Radius.Description: The radius of the compass in pixels. The compass is an imaginary circular element around your character that shows the direction of markers that are currently out of view.
CVAR.Markers.Compass.IconScaleFactor.Des: The scale factor of the icons on the compass. This value is a percentage of the default size.
CVAR.Markers.Compass.IconOpacity.Name: Compass Icon Opacity
CVAR.Markers.Compass.IconOpacity.Descrip: The opacity of the icons on the compass. 100 is fully opaque, 0 is fully transparent.
CVAR.Markers.Renderer.Enabled.Name: Enable 3D Markers
CVAR.Markers.Renderer.Enabled.Descriptio: Whether to show markers in the game world.
The distance in yalms at which markers are grouped together into a single marker. This can help reduce clutter when there are many markers in the same area.
CVAR.Markers.Renderer.MaxWidth.Name: Max text width
CVAR.Markers.Renderer.MaxWidth.Descripti: The maximum width of a marker in pixels. Increase this value to show more text on markers if it gets cut off too often.
CVAR.General.UiScale.Name: UI Scale
CVAR.General.UiScale.Description: The interface scale factor for all Umbra elements. This value is a percentage of the default size. Hit enter to apply the given value. Note that input elements are not affected by this setting. Use the global font scaling setting in Dalamud settings for those instead.
CVAR.General.UseThreadedStyleComputation: [HIGHLY EXPERIMENTAL] Whether to use multithreading to compute the style of the toolbar and widgets. This will benefit performance, but may be unstable in some situations, causing some elements to render inaccurately. Keep this setting disabled if you experience any graphical issues.
CVAR.General.LanguageOverride.Name: Language Override (Reloads the plugin)
CVAR.General.LanguageOverride.Descriptio: Overrides Dalamud's language setting for Umbra. Note that this only affects Umbra-specific translations. Texts that come from the game itself will still be shown in the game's language. Modifying this value will reload the plugin, causing the settings window to close.
CVAR.General.EnableImageProcessing.Name: Enable image processing on some icon elements
CVAR.General.EnableImageProcessing.Descr: Performs some image manipulation on some icons to improve their appearance. You may want to disable this if you have custom icon packs installed. Modifying this value will restart the plugin to invalidate caches. This causes the settings window to close itself.
CVAR.General.ShowToolbarInCutscenes.Name: Show the toolbar while playing cutscenes
CVAR.General.ShowToolbarInGPose.Name: Show the toolbar while GPose is active
CVAR.General.ShowToolbarOnUserHide.Name: Show the toolbar when the UI is manually hidden
CVAR.General.ShowToolbarBetweenAreas.Nam: Show the toolbar during loading screens
CVAR.General.ShowToolbarDuringIdleCam.Na: Show the toolbar during idle camera (AFK) mode
CVAR.General.ShowToolbarInDuty.Name: Show the toolbar in duties
CVAR.General.ShowToolbarInCombat.Name: Show the toolbar during combat
CVAR.General.ShowMarkersInCutscenes.Name: Show world markers while playing cutscenes
CVAR.General.ShowMarkersInGPose.Name: Show world markers while GPose is active
CVAR.General.ShowMarkersOnUserHide.Name: Show world markers when the UI is manually hidden
CVAR.General.ShowMarkersBetweenAreas.Nam: Show world markers during loading screens
CVAR.General.ShowMarkersDuringIdleCam.Na: Show world markers during idle camera (AFK) mode
CVAR.General.ShowMarkersInDuty.Name: Show world markers in duties
CVAR.General.ShowMarkersInCombat.Name: Show world markers during combat
CVAR.Window.EnableClipping.Name: Enable window clipping
CVAR.Window.EnableClipping.Description: Allows windows to render behind native game windows. This may have a slight performance cost and may not work properly for all native game windows. Note that this feature does not work when Multi-monitor support is enabled in Dalamud settings.
CVAR.Toolbar.Enabled.Name: Enable the toolbar
CVAR.Toolbar.Enabled.Description: Whether to display the toolbar. Use the "/umbra" command to open the settings window if you decide to disable the toolbar.
CVAR.Toolbar.PopupAlignmentMethod.Name: Widget popup alignment method
CVAR.Toolbar.PopupAlignmentMethod.Descri: The method used to align popup menus to their widgets. The 'Centered' option will always try to center a popup menu based on the widget location, while the 'aligned' method always aligns the popup to the left or right side of the widget, depending on the location of the widget on the toolbar. The latter option also helps stabilizing widget positions when the widget popup is dynamically resized.
CVAR.Toolbar.IsTopAligned.Name: Place the toolbar at the top of the screen.
CVAR.Toolbar.IsTopAligned.Description: Aligns the toolbar to the top of the screen rather than the bottom.
CVAR.Toolbar.IsStretched.Name: Stretch the toolbar to the screen edges
CVAR.Toolbar.IsStretched.Description: Stretches the toolbar to the left and right edges of the screen.
CVAR.Toolbar.IsAutoHideEnabled.Name: Automatically hide the toolbar
CVAR.Toolbar.IsAutoHideEnabled.Descripti: Hides the toolbar when the mouse cursor is not near it. The toolbar will reappear when the mouse cursor is near the toolbar.
CVAR.Toolbar.AutoHideDuringCutscenes.Nam: Automatically hide the toolbar during cutscenes
CVAR.Toolbar.AutoHideDuringCutscenes.Des: Forces the auto-hide behavior during cutscenes, allowing the toolbar to be hidden during cutscenes unless the mouse cursor is near it.
CVAR.Toolbar.AutoHideDuringDuty.Name: Automatically hide the toolbar during duties
CVAR.Toolbar.AutoHideDuringDuty.Descript: Forces the auto-hide behavior during duties, allowing the toolbar to be hidden during duties unless the mouse cursor is near it.
CVAR.Toolbar.AutoHideDuringPvp.Name: Automatically hide the toolbar during PVP
CVAR.Toolbar.AutoHideDuringPvp.Descripti: Forces the auto-hide behavior during pvp, allowing the toolbar to be hidden during pvp unless the mouse cursor is near it.
CVAR.Toolbar.EnableQuickSettingAccess.De: Allows you to quickly access settings of widgets by holding CONTROL + SHIFT and right-clicking on them from the toolbar. Note that enabling this setting will cause some widgets to appear interactable when hovering over them, while they are not.
CVAR.Toolbar.Height.Name: Toolbar height
CVAR.Toolbar.Height.Description: The height of the toolbar in pixels.
CVAR.Toolbar.ItemSpacing.Name: Toolbar widget spacing
CVAR.Toolbar.ItemSpacing.Description: Defines the distance between toolbar widgets in pixels.
CVAR.Toolbar.EnableShadow.Name: Enable toolbar shadow
CVAR.Toolbar.EnableShadow.Description: Adds a soft shadow to the toolbar to make it stand out more.
CVAR.Toolbar.EnableInactiveColors.Name: Enable inactive color
CVAR.Toolbar.EnableInactiveColors.Descri: Changes the color of the toolbar when the mouse cursor is not near it. Use the 'inactive' colors in the color profile to customize this appearance.
CVAR.Toolbar.MarginLeft.Name: Toolbar left margin
CVAR.Toolbar.MarginLeft.Description: The distance between the left edge of the screen and the toolbar in pixels.
CVAR.Toolbar.MarginRight.Name: Toolbar right margin
CVAR.Toolbar.MarginRight.Description: The distance between the right edge of the screen and the toolbar in pixels.
CVAR.Toolbar.YOffset.Name: Toolbar vertical offset
CVAR.Toolbar.YOffset.Description: The vertical offset of the toolbar from the top or bottom of the screen in pixels.
Widgets.DefaultToolbarWidget.Config.Deco: Decorates the widget with a background and border.
Widgets.DefaultToolbarWidget.Config.Desa: Desaturates the icon of the widget to make it appear in grayscale. Note that it might be harder to see if the button is disabled when this option is enabled.
Widgets.DefaultToolbarWidget.Config.Disp: The way the widget should be displayed.
Widgets.DefaultToolbarWidget.Config.Icon: The location of the icon relative to the text.
A custom size for the button icon in pixels. Set to 0 to use the default size.
Widgets.DefaultToolbarWidget.Config.Text: The alignment of the widget text.

The vertical offset of the text from the center in pixels. Positive values move the text down, negative values move the text up. This setting is only applicable if the widget is showing a single label.
The vertical offset of the text from the center in pixels. Positive values move the text down, negative values move the text up. This setting is only applicable if the widget is showing two labels.
The vertical offset of the text from the center in pixels. Positive values move the text down, negative values move the text up. This setting is only applicable if the widget is showing two labels.
Widgets.DefaultToolbarWidget.Config.Icon: The vertical offset of the icon from the center of the widget in pixels. Positive values move the icon down, negative values move the icon up.
Widgets.DefaultToolbarWidget.Config.Labe: The maximum width of the label in pixels. If the label is longer than this value, it will be truncated and an ellipsis will be added. Set to 0 to disable fixed width and let the widget automatically adjust its width based on the label content.
Widget.Accessibility.Name: Accessibility
Widget.Accessibility.Description: Provides you with quick access to accessibility features.
Widget.Accessibility.Config.Decorate.Des: Decorates the accessibility widget with a background and border.
The vertical offset of the text from the center of the widget in pixels. Positive values move the text down, negative values move the text up.
The vertical offset of the mail icon from the center of the widget in pixels. Positive values move the icon down, negative values move the icon up.
Widget.BattleEffects.Name: Battle Effects Configurator
Widget.BattleEffects.Description: Provides you with options to quickly change the intensity of battle effects, as well as pet sizes of summoners.
Widget.BattleEffects.Config.Decorate.Des: Decorates the accessibility widget with a background and border.
The vertical offset of the mail icon from the center of the widget in pixels. Positive values move the icon down, negative values move the icon up.
Widget.Clock.Name: Clock
Widget.Clock.Description: Displays the current local, server or Eorzea time with lots of customization options.
Widget.Clock.Config.TextYOffset.Name: Text vertical offset
Widget.Clock.Config.TextYOffset.Descript: The vertical offset of the clock text from the center of the clock in pixels. Positive values move the text down, negative values move the text up.
Widget.Clock.Config.PrefixYOffset.Name: Prefix vertical offset
Widget.Clock.Config.PrefixYOffset.Descri: The vertical offset of the prefix text/symbol from the center of the clock in pixels. Positive values move the text down, negative values move the text up.
Widget.Clock.Config.ShowSeconds.Name: Show seconds
Widget.Clock.Config.ShowSeconds.Descript: Whether to show the seconds part of the clock.
Widget.Clock.Config.ClickToSwitch.Name: Enable click to switch time source
Widget.Clock.Config.ClickToSwitch.Descri: Allows you to switch between local, server and Eorzea time by clicking on the clock. A tooltip will show the current time source when hovering over the clock while this option is enabled.
Widget.Clock.Config.Use24HourFormat.Name: Use 24-hour format
Widget.Clock.Config.Use24HourFormat.Desc: Whether to use a 24-hour format for the clock. If disabled, the clock will use a 12-hour format with AM/PM indicators.
Widget.Clock.Config.UseCustomPrefix.Name: Use custom prefix text
Widget.Clock.Config.UseCustomPrefix.Desc: Whether to use a custom text before the clock time. Uses the default game glyphs based on the time source if disabled.
Widget.Clock.Config.Decorate.Name: Decorate the widget
Widget.Clock.Config.Decorate.Description: Decorates the clock widget with a background and border.
Widget.Clock.Config.PrefixText.Name: Prefix text
Widget.Clock.Config.PrefixText.Descripti: Text that is displayed before the clock time. This can be used to add a label to the clock, for example: 'LT', 'ST' or 'ET'.
Widget.Clock.Config.TimeSource.Name: Time source
Widget.Clock.Config.TimeSource.Descripti: The source of the time that is displayed on the clock.
Widget.Clock.Config.AmLabel.Name: AM label
Widget.Clock.Config.AmLabel.Description: The text that is displayed for the AM part of the clock when using a 12-hour format.
Widget.Clock.Config.PmLabel.Name: PM label
Widget.Clock.Config.PmLabel.Description: The text that is displayed for the PM part of the clock when using a 12-hour format.
Widget.Clock.Config.CustomWidth.Name: Custom time display width
Widget.Clock.Config.CustomWidth.Descript: The width of the clock text in pixels. If set to 0, the width will be calculated automatically based on the text content. You may want to choose a fixed with when you use a custom monospace font that does not have fixed-width characters to prevent the widget from resizing when the time changes.
Widget.CollectionItemButton.Name: Collection Item Button
Widget.CollectionItemButton.Description: Provides you with quick access an item of your choosing from your collections list.
The item from the collections list that is displayed on the widget and used when clicked.
Widget.Durability.Name: Durability & Spiritbond
Widget.Durability.Description: Shows the current durability state and spiritbond progress of your equipped gear with quick access to the Repair & Extract Materia actions.
Widget.Durability.Config.Decorate.Name: Decorate the widget
Widget.Durability.Config.Decorate.Descri: Decorates the durability widget with a background and border.
Widget.Durability.Config.WarningThreshol: The durability percentage at which the widget will change its icon to a warning symbol.
Widget.Durability.Config.CriticalThresho: The durability percentage at which the widget will change its icon to a critical symbol.
Widget.Durability.Config.DisplayMode.Des: The way the durability and spiritbond information is displayed on the widget itself.
Widget.Durability.Config.DisplayMode.Opt: Show both durability and spiritbond percentages with labels.
Show both durability and spiritbond percentages without labels on a single line (durability% / spiritbond%)
Show only the durability percentage without a label.
Show only the spiritbond percentage without a label.
Widget.Durability.Config.HideWhenOkay.Na: Hide the widget when no action is needed
Widget.Durability.Config.HideWhenOkay.De: Automatically hides the widget when all equipped gear is above the warning threshold and there is nothing to extract materia from.
Widget.Durability.Config.TextAlign.Name: Text alignment
Widget.Durability.Config.TextAlign.Descr: The alignment of the location text.
Widget.Durability.Config.TextYOffset.Nam: Text vertical offset (If ony label is visible)
Widget.Durability.Config.TextYOffset.Des: The vertical offset of the text from the center in pixels. Positive values move the text down, negative values move the text up.
Top Text vertical offset (Durability if two labels are visible)
The vertical offset of the text from the center in pixels. Positive values move the text down, negative values move the text up.
Widget.Durability.Config.TextYOffsetBott: Bottom Text vertical offset (Spiritbond if two labels are visible)
The vertical offset of the text from the center in pixels. Positive values move the text down, negative values move the text up.
Widget.Durability.Config.IconLocation.De: The location of the durability icon relative to the text.
Desaturates the widget icon to make it appear in grayscale.
Widget.ExperienceBar.Name: Experience Bar
Widget.ExperienceBar.Description: Shows your current experience points percentage and visualizes the progress towards the next level.
Widget.ExperienceBar.Config.ShowExperien: Whether to show the current experience points percentage on the experience bar.
Widget.ExperienceBar.Config.ShowLevel.De: Whether to show the current level on the experience bar.
The width of the experience bar in pixels.
Widget.ExperienceBar.Config.DisplayAtMax: Whether to show the experience bar when the current job is at the maximum level.
Widget.InventorySpace.Name: Inventory Space Indicator
Widget.InventorySpace.Description: Shows the current amount of free space in your inventory.
Widget.InventorySpace.Config.Source.Name: Inventory source
Widget.InventorySpace.Config.Source.Desc: The inventory that is used to calculate the free space.
Widget.InventorySpace.Config.ShowTotal.D: Whether to show the total amount of inventory space in addition to the free space.
Widget.InventorySpace.Config.ShowRemaini: Whether to show the remaining amount of inventory slots instead of used slots.
Widget.InventorySpace.Config.WarningThre: The amount of free inventory space at which the widget will change its icon to a warning symbol.
Widget.InventorySpace.Config.CriticalThr: The amount of free inventory space at which the widget will change its icon to a critical symbol.
Widget.Location.Name: Location
Widget.Location.Description: Displays the current map and area name.
Widget.Location.Config.ShowDistrict.Name: Show district name
Widget.Location.Config.ShowDistrict.Desc: Whether to show the name of the current sub-zone / district.
Widget.Location.Config.UseTwoLabels.Name: Use two labels
Widget.Location.Config.UseTwoLabels.Desc: Whether to use two separate labels for the map and district name.
Widget.Location.Config.ShowCoordinates.D: Whether to show the current player coordinates. Enabling this will replace the district name with the player coordinates.
Widget.DtrBar.Name: Server Info Bar
Widget.DtrBar.Description: Displays a group of widgets that originate from the In-game server info bar.
Widget.DtrBar.Config.DecorateMode.Name: Decorate mode
Widget.DtrBar.Config.DecorateMode.Descri: Determines when server info bar entries should be decorated with a background and border.
Widget.DtrBar.Config.PlainText.Name: Show items as plain text
Widget.DtrBar.Config.PlainText.Descripti: Shows the items as plain text without any decoration such as custom colors and icons. Enabling this option will increase performance.
Widget.DtrBar.Config.TextYOffset.Name: Text vertical offset
Widget.DtrBar.Config.TextYOffset.Descrip: The vertical offset of the text from the center of the widget in pixels. Positive values move the text down, negative values move the text up.
Widget.DtrBar.Config.HideNative.Name: Auto-hide the native server info bar
Widget.DtrBar.Config.HideNative.Descript: Hides the native server info bar when the server info bar widget is visible. The native server info bar will be shown again when the widget is no longer visible.
Widget.DtrBar.Config.ItemSpacing.Name: Item spacing
Widget.DtrBar.Config.ItemSpacing.Descrip: The distance between server info bar items in pixels.
Widget.PluginList.Name: Plugin List
Widget.PluginList.Description: Quick access to your installed Dalamud plugins that provide a main command and/or settings.
Widget.PluginList.Tooltip: Right-click to open Dalamud's Plugin Installer window. Hold control or shift while clicking a plugin in the menu to open its configuration window if it also has a main window.
Widget.PluginList.Config.Decorate.Name: Decorate the widget
Widget.PluginList.Config.Decorate.Descri: Decorates the mail indicator widget with a background and border.
Widget.PluginList.Config.IconYOffset.Des: The vertical offset of the mail icon from the center of the widget in pixels. Positive values move the icon down, negative values move the icon up.
Widget.PluginList.Config.EnabledCategory: Visible plugins (Restart Umbra to refresh this list)
Widget.RetainerList.Name: Retainers
Widget.RetainerList.Description: Shows a list of your retainers with quick access to an overview that displays their venture status, amount of items on sale and how much gil is kept. Note that not all information may be up-to-date until you visit a summoning bell.
Widget.RetainerList.Popup.Name: Name
Widget.RetainerList.Config.IconType.Name: Job icon type
Widget.RetainerList.Config.IconType.Desc: The type of icon that is used to represent the job of the retainer.
Widget.Separator.Name: Separator
Widget.Separator.Description: A simple line separator that can be used to separate other widgets.
Widget.Separator.Config.Width.Name: Additional width
Widget.Separator.Config.Width.Descriptio: The extra width of the distance between widgets in pixels. Widget spacing in Toolbar customization settings is always taken into account, regardless of this setting.
Widget.Separator.Config.LineWidth.Name: Line width
Widget.Separator.Config.LineWidth.Descri: The width of the line in pixels.
Widget.Separator.Config.LineHeight.Name: Line height
Widget.Separator.Config.LineHeight.Descr: The height of the line in pixels.
Widget.Separator.Config.LineColor.Name: Line color
Widget.Spacer.Name: Spacer
Widget.Spacer.Description: A simple spacer with a configurable width that can be used to separate other widgets.
Widget.Spacer.Config.Width.Name: Additional width
Widget.Spacer.Config.Width.Description: The extra width of the distance between widgets in pixels. Widget spacing in Toolbar customization settings is always taken into account, regardless of this setting.
Widget.MailIndicator.Name: Unread Mail Indicator
Widget.MailIndicator.Description: Shows a small mail icon when you have unread mail.
Widget.MailIndicator.Tooltip.Singular: You have an unread message. Visit a Delivery Moogle to read it.
Widget.MailIndicator.Tooltip.Plural: You have {0} unread messages. Visit a Delivery Moogle to read them.
Widget.MailIndicator.Config.Decorate.Des: Decorates the mail indicator widget with a background and border.
Widget.MailIndicator.Config.AlwaysShow.D: Always show the mail indicator, even when there is no mail. The widget will show itself in a disabled state when there is no unread mail.
The vertical offset of the mail icon from the center of the widget in pixels. Positive values move the icon down, negative values move the icon up.
Widget.Weather.Name: Weather Forecast
Widget.Weather.Description: Shows the current weather and the upcoming weather forecast for the next couple of hours.
Widget.Weather.Config.ShowName.Name: Show weather name
Widget.Weather.Config.ShowName.Descripti: Whether to show the name of the current weather.
Widget.Weather.Config.ShowTime.Name: Show weather change time
Widget.Weather.Config.ShowTime.Descripti: Whether to show the time of the weather change.
Widget.Weather.Config.MaxForecastEntries: The maximum number of weather forecast entries to show in the popup when the widget is clicked. A value of 0 will prevent the popup from opening.
Widget.Weather.Config.Spacing.Name: Spacing between weather icon and text
Widget.Weather.Config.Spacing.Descriptio: The distance between the weather icon and the text. This setting only applies to the toolbar widget itself.
Widget.WorldName.Name: World Name
Widget.WorldName.Description: Shows the name of the current world. Has an option to hide itself when you are on your home world.
Hides the widget when you are on your home world. This can be useful to preserve space in the toolbar.
Widget.WorldName.Config.Decorate.Name: Decorate the widget
Widget.WorldName.Config.Decorate.Descrip: Decorates the widget with a background and border.
Widget.WorldName.Config.TextYOffset.Name: Text vertical offset
Widget.WorldName.Config.TextYOffset.Desc: The vertical offset of the text from the center of the widget in pixels. Positive values move the text down, negative values move the text up.
Widget.WorldName.Config.ShowIcon.Name: Show the cross-world icon
Widget.WorldName.Config.ShowIcon.Descrip: Shows a small icon next to the world name to indicate that you are on a different world compared to your home world.
Widget.WorldName.Config.IconLocation.Des: The location of the cross-world icon relative to the world name.
Widget.MainMenu.Name: Main Menu Button
Widget.MainMenu.Description: Shows a button that opens the configured main menu.
Widget.MainMenu.Config.Category.Name: Menu category
Widget.MainMenu.Config.Category.Descript: The category of the main menu that should be opened when the button is clicked.
Widget.MainMenu.Config.CustomIconId.Name: Custom icon ID
Widget.MainMenu.Config.CustomIconId.Desc: The custom icon ID that should be used for the main menu button. This can be used to override the default icon. Use the command "/xldata icons" to browse available icons to get the correct ID. Use ID 0 to use the default icon.
Widget.MainMenu.Config.ShowItemIcons.Nam: Show item icons in the menu
Widget.MainMenu.Config.ShowItemIcons.Des: Whether to show icons in the popup menu for items that have icons associated with them.
Widget.MainMenu.Config.GrayscaleIcons.De: Desaturates the icons in the popup menu to make them appear in grayscale. This can be a bit more subtle and pleasing to the eye.
Widget.Currencies.Name: Currencies
Widget.Currencies.Description: Shows the current amount of gil and company credits.
Widget.Currencies.Config.EnabledCurrency: Visible currencies in the popup menu
Widget.Currencies.Config.TrackedCurrency: The currency that should be tracked and displayed in the widget on the toolbar.
Widget.Currencies.Config.ShowName.Name: Show tracked currency name
Widget.Currencies.Config.ShowName.Descri: Whether to show the name of the tracked currency next to the value.
Widget.Currencies.Config.ShowCap.Name: Show currency cap (if available)
Widget.Currencies.Config.ShowCap.Descrip: Whether to show the currency cap of the tracked currency next to the value.
Widget.Currencies.Config.CurrencySeparat: The character that separates thousands in the currency value for better readability.
Widget.Currencies.Config.CustomWidgetLab: A custom label that should be displayed when no currency is being tracked. Leave empty to use the default label.
Widget.Currencies.Config.DesaturateIcons: Desaturates the icons in the popup menu to make them appear in grayscale. This can be a bit more subtle and pleasing to the eye.
Widget.Currencies.Config.CustomCurrencyI: A comma-separated list of custom currency/item IDs to show in the popup. This can be used to track currencies that are not part of the default list. Use SimpleTweak's "Show ID" tooltip feature to find out the ID of an item or currency.
Widget.Currencies.Config.EnableMouseInte: Shows a popup menu with all currencies when clicking on the widget.
Widget.EmoteChatIndicator.Name: Emote Chat Indicator
Widget.EmoteChatIndicator.Description: Shows an indicator when emotes are being written to the chat, with an option to turn it off.
Widget.EmoteChatIndicator.Tooltip.Enable: Emotes are being written to the chat. Click to disable.
Widget.EmoteChatIndicator.Tooltip.Disabl: Emotes are not being written to the chat. Click to enable.
Widget.EmoteChatIndicator.Config.Decorat: Decorates the widget with a background and border.
Widget.EmoteChatIndicator.Config.IconYOf: The vertical offset of the icon from the center of the widget in pixels. Positive values move the icon down, negative values move the icon up.
Widget.EmoteChatIndicator.Config.OnlySho: Only shows the emote chat indicator when writing emotes to the chat is enabled.
Widget.ToolbarPin.Name: Toolbar Pin
Widget.ToolbarPin.Description: A simple button that allows you to toggle the toolbar's auto-hide feature.
Widget.ToolbarPin.Config.Decorate.Name: Decorate the button
Widget.ToolbarPin.Config.Decorate.Descri: Decorates the toolbar pin button with a background and border.
Widget.ToolbarPin.Config.IconYOffset.Des: The vertical offset of the lock icon from the center of the widget in pixels. Positive values moves the icon down, negative values moves it up.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Name: Gearset Switcher
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Description: Shows your currently equipped gearset and some statistics about it. The popup of this widget provides you with an organized overview of all your gearsets, categorized by role.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.WarningTooltip.Ap: One or more items did not have the specified appearance.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.WarningTooltip.Mi: One or more items were missing from your Armoury Chest.
The specified main arm was missing from your Armoury Chest.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.ShowItemLe: Show item level on the toolbar widget
Whether to show the item level, or job level and experience, of the currently equipped gearset on the toolbar widget.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.WidgetButt: The type of icon that should be displayed on the toolbar widget button.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.EnableRole: Limit role container heights and enable scrolling

Limits the height of the role containers in the popup and enables scrolling when there are too many gearsets to display. You can customize the maximum amount of visible gearsets per role in the options below.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.PopupHeade: The type of icon that should be displayed in the popup header.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.PopupButto: The type of icon that should be displayed on the gearset buttons in the popup.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.AutoCloseO: Automatically closes the popup when a gearset is selected.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.ShowRoleNa: Whether to show the role names in the popup.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.ShowCurren: Whether to show the currently selected job's role color as a gradient across the whole popup.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.GearsetBut: The type of background that should be displayed on the gearset buttons in the popup.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.ShowWarnin: Shows a warning symbol on gearset buttons that have issues with missing items or appearance differences.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.ShowExperi: Whether to show the experience bar on the gearset buttons in the popup.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.ShowButton: Show item level on gearset buttons
Whether to show the item level of the gearset on the gearset buttons in the popup.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.HeaderIcon: The vertical offset of the job icon from the center of the popup header in pixels. Positive values move the icon down, negative values move the icon up.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.ButtonIcon: The vertical offset of the job icon from the center of the gearset buttons in the popup in pixels. Positive values move the icon down, negative values move the icon up.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.ShowRole.D: Whether to show the gearsets associated with this role in the popup.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.RoleLocati: The location of the gearsets associated with this role in the popup.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.RoleSortIn: The order in which the roles are displayed in the popup within the configured column. Lower values are displayed first.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.RoleMaxIte: The maximum number of gearsets to show for this role before the list starts to scroll.
Widget.OnlineStatus.Name: Online Status
Widget.OnlineStatus.Description: Shows your current online status and gives you the option to change it.
Widget.OnlineStatus.Tooltip: Right-click to open the search info window.
Widget.MarkerControl.Name: World Marker Control
Widget.MarkerControl.Description: Allows you to quickly toggle world marker types on and off from a popup menu.
Widget.MarkerControl.Config.Decorate.Des: Decorates the marker control widget with a background and border.
The vertical offset of the marker icon from the center of the widget in pixels. Positive values move the icon down, negative values move the icon up.
Widget.Teleport.Name: Teleport
Widget.Teleport.Description: Provides quick access to unlocked Aetherytes in an organized menu based on expansion.
Widget.Teleport.Config.MinimumColumns.De: Adds blank columns to teleport menus to prevent the popup from changing its size when switching expansions. This option is useful when the teleport widget is in the center column of the toolbar and the widget popup alignment option is set to 'center'.
Widget.Teleport.Config.ExpansionListPosi: The position of the expansion list in the teleport popup. The 'Automatic' option sets the position based on the widget location on the toolbar.
Shows a notification on your screen to confirm where you are teleporting to after clicking a teleport destination in the menu.
Widget.Teleport.Config.OpenFavoritesByDe: Opens the favorites list by default when the teleport widget is clicked, rather than the expansion you're currently in.
Widget.Teleport.Config.ShowMapNames.Name: Show map names
Widget.Teleport.Config.ShowMapNames.Desc: Groups teleport destinations by map name in the popup. Disable this to make the popup more condensed and take up less space on your screen.
Widget.Volume.Name: Volume Control
Widget.Volume.Description: Allows you to control the volume of different audio channels in the game.
Widget.Volume.Option.SoundHousing: Play city-state music in residential areas
Widget.Volume.Option.SoundHousing.Descri: Requires you to re-enter the area to take effect.
Widget.Volume.Config.ShowOptions.Name: Show additional sound options
Widget.Volume.Config.ShowOptions.Descrip: Shows additional sound options in the popup menu to control specific settings related to music.
Widget.Volume.Config.ShowBgm.Name: Show Background Music
Widget.Volume.Config.ShowBgm.Description: Shows the background music volume control in the popup menu.
Widget.Volume.Config.ShowSfx.Name: Show Sound Effects
Widget.Volume.Config.ShowSfx.Description: Shows the sound effects volume control in the popup menu.
Widget.Volume.Config.ShowVoc.Name: Show Voice Volume
Widget.Volume.Config.ShowVoc.Description: Shows the voice volume control in the popup menu.
Widget.Volume.Config.ShowAmb.Name: Show Ambient Volume
Widget.Volume.Config.ShowAmb.Description: Shows the environment volume control in the popup menu.
Widget.Volume.Config.ShowSys.Name: Show System Sounds
Widget.Volume.Config.ShowSys.Description: Shows the system sounds volume control in the popup menu.
Widget.Volume.Config.ShowPerf.Name: Show Bard Performance Volume
Widget.Volume.Config.ShowPerf.Descriptio: Shows the bard performance volume control in the popup menu.
Widget.Volume.Config.ValueStep.Name: Volume value step
Widget.Volume.Config.ValueStep.Descripti: The amount by which the volume should be increased or decreased when using the volume control slider.
Widget.Volume.Config.Decorate.Name: Decorate the widget
Widget.Volume.Config.Decorate.Descriptio: Decorates the marker control widget with a background and border.
Widget.Volume.Config.IconYOffset.Name: Icon vertical offset
Widget.Volume.Config.IconYOffset.Descrip: The vertical offset of the marker icon from the center of the widget in pixels. Positive values move the icon down, negative values move the icon up.
Widget.Companion.Name: Companion
Widget.Companion.Description: Provides quick access to summon or dismiss your chocobo companion, as well as change its stance.
Widget.CustomButton.Name: Custom Button
Widget.CustomButton.Description: A customizable button that can be used to execute a command.
Widget.CustomButton.Config.HideLabel.Des: Hides the button label even though it has a value, which allows you to distinguish this instance from others in the widget arrangement settings window.
Widget.CustomButton.Config.Label.Name: Button label
Widget.CustomButton.Config.Label.Descrip: The text that is displayed on the button.
Widget.CustomButton.Config.Tooltip.Name: Button tooltip
Widget.CustomButton.Config.Tooltip.Descr: The tooltip that is displayed when hovering over the button.
Widget.CustomButton.Config.Command.Name: Command or website URL
Widget.CustomButton.Config.Command.Descr: Depending on the selected mode, invokes the given command that is executed when the button is clicked. For example: /dance., or opens a website in your default browser if the URL mode is selected.
Widget.CustomButton.Config.Mode.Name: Button mode
Widget.CustomButton.Config.Mode.Descript: What to do when clicking this button. A command represents a single chat command, while a URL will open a website in your default browser.
Widget.CustomButton.Config.LeftIconId.De: The icon ID that should be displayed on the left side of the button. Use the command "/xldata icons" to browse available icons to get the correct ID. Use ID 0 to hide the icon.
Widget.CustomButton.Config.RightIconId.D: The icon ID that should be displayed on the right side of the button. Use the command "/xldata icons" to browse available icons to get the correct ID. Use ID 0 to hide the icon.
Widget.CustomMenu.Name: Custom Menu
Widget.CustomMenu.Description: Shows a customizable menu that can be used to execute commands or open websites.
Widget.CustomMenu.Config.HideLabel.Name: Hide button label
Widget.CustomMenu.Config.HideLabel.Descr: Hides the button label even though it has a value, which allows you to distinguish this instance from others in the widget arrangement settings window.
Widget.CustomMenu.Config.Label.Name: Button label
Widget.CustomMenu.Config.Label.Descripti: The text that is displayed on the widget.
Widget.CustomMenu.Config.Tooltip.Name: Button tooltip
Widget.CustomMenu.Config.Tooltip.Descrip: The tooltip that is displayed when hovering over the widget.
Widget.CustomMenu.Config.Decorate.Name: Decorate the button
Widget.CustomMenu.Config.Decorate.Descri: Decorates the custom button with a background and border.
Desaturates the widget icon to make it appear in grayscale.
Widget.CustomMenu.Config.IconYOffset.Des: The vertical offset of the icon from the center of the widget in pixels. Positive values move the icon down, negative values move the icon up.
Widget.CustomMenu.Config.TextYOffset.Des: The vertical offset of the text from the center of the widget in pixels. Positive values move the text down, negative values move the text up.
Widget.CustomMenu.Config.LeftIconId.Name: Left icon ID
Widget.CustomMenu.Config.LeftIconId.Desc: The icon ID that should be displayed on the left side of the button. Use the command "/xldata icons" to browse available icons to get the correct ID. Use ID 0 to hide the icon.
Widget.CustomMenu.Config.RightIconId.Des: The icon ID that should be displayed on the right side of the button. Use the command "/xldata icons" to browse available icons to get the correct ID. Use ID 0 to hide the icon.
Widget.CustomMenu.Config.DesaturateMenuI: Desaturates the icons in the menu to make it appear in grayscale.
Widget.CustomMenu.Config.ButtonLabel.Des: The text that is displayed on the button. This option is ignored when the Item-mode is selected and a valid item ID is given in the command field.
A sub-label that is displayed on the right side on the menu item, typically used for item counts, shortcuts, etc. This option is ignored when the Item-mode is selected and a valid item ID is given in the command field.
Widget.CustomMenu.Config.ButtonIconId.De: The icon ID that should be displayed on the button. Use the command "/xldata icons" to browse available icons to get the correct ID. Use ID 0 to hide the icon. This option is ignored when the Item-mode is selected and a valid item ID is given in the command field.
Widget.CustomMenu.Config.ButtonCommand.D: Depending on the selected mode, invokes the given command that is executed when the button is clicked. For example: /dance., or opens a website in your default browser if the URL mode is selected. When the Item-mode is selected and a valid item ID is given in the command field, the button name and icon of the button will be overridden with the item's name and icon.
Widget.CustomMenu.Config.ButtonMode.Name: Button mode
Widget.CustomMenu.Config.ButtonMode.Desc: What to do when clicking this button. A command represents a single chat command, while a URL will open a website in your default browser. When the Item-mode is selected and a valid item ID is given in the command field, the button name and icon of the button will be overridden with the item's name and icon.
Widget.CustomMenu.Config.ButtonMode.Opti: Use an item from your inventory
Widget.CustomMenu.Config.InverseOrder.De: Reverses the order of the menu entries.
Widget.CustomMenu.Config.CloseOnClick.Na: Close menu when clicking an item
Widget.CustomMenu.Config.CloseOnClick.De: Whether the popup menu should close when clicking on a non-disabled menu item.
Widget.CustomMenu.Config.ItemUsage.Name: Quality priority for item entries
Widget.CustomMenu.Config.ItemUsage.Descr: Whether to prioritize HQ vs NQ items, or only use one type of item, regardless of what is available.
Widget.CustomMenu.Config.ItemUsage.Optio: High quality first, fallback to normal quality
Normal quality first, fallback to high quality
Widget.EmoteList.Name: Emote List
Widget.EmoteList.Description: Shows a list of custom assigned emotes that can be used to quickly perform them.
Widget.EmoteList.Config.Label.Name: Button label
Widget.EmoteList.Config.Label.Descriptio: The text that is displayed on the button.
Widget.EmoteList.Config.IconId.Name: Icon ID
Widget.EmoteList.Config.IconId.Descripti: The icon ID that should be displayed on the button. Use the command "/xldata icons" to browse available icons to get the correct ID. Use ID 0 to hide the icon.
Widget.EmoteList.Config.CategoryName.Des: The name of the category. Leaving this field empty will disable (hide) the category from the popup.
Widget.EmoteList.PickerWindow.Title: Emote Picker
Widget.ItemButton.Name: Item Button
Widget.ItemButton.Description: A customizable button that can be used to use an item from your inventory, provided you have the item in your inventory.
Widget.ItemButton.Config.ItemId.Name: Item ID
Widget.ItemButton.Config.ItemId.Descript: The ID of the item to use when the button is clicked. Use SimpleTweaks' "Show ID" tooltip tweak to find the correct ID of items in your inventory.
Widget.ItemButton.Config.ItemUsage.Name: Item type priority
Widget.ItemButton.Config.ItemUsage.Descr: Whether to prioritize HQ vs NQ items, or only use one type of item, regardless of what is available.
Widget.ItemButton.Config.ItemUsage.Optio: High quality first, fallback to normal quality
Normal quality first, fallback to high quality
Hide the button if the item is not in your inventory
Hides the button from the toolbar if the configured item is not in your inventory.
Widget.ItemButton.Config.Decorate.Name: Decorate the button
Widget.ItemButton.Config.Decorate.Descri: Decorates the custom button with a background and border.
Widget.ItemButton.Config.ShowLabel.Name: Show item name
Widget.ItemButton.Config.ShowLabel.Descr: Whether to show the name of the item on the label of the button.
Widget.ItemButton.Config.ShowCount.Name: Show item count
Widget.ItemButton.Config.ShowCount.Descr: Whether to show the count of the item in your inventory on the button label.
Widget.ItemButton.Config.IconLocation.De: The location of the icon relative to the text.
Widget.ItemButton.Config.IconYOffset.Des: The vertical offset of the icon from the center of the widget in pixels. Positive values move the icon down, negative values move the icon up.
Widget.ItemButton.Config.TextYOffset.Des: The vertical offset of the text from the center of the widget in pixels. Positive values move the text down, negative values move the text up.
Widget.Flag.Name: Flag Marker
Widget.Flag.Description: Shows a widget that appears when a flag marker has been set that allows you to teleport to a nearby aetheryte.
Widget.Flag.Tooltip:
Left-click to teleport to a nearby aetheryte.
Right-click to remove the flag marker.
Widget.Flag.Config.Decorate.Name: Decorate the widget
Widget.Flag.Config.Decorate.Description: Decorates the flag marker widget with a background and border.
Widget.Flag.Config.IconYOffset.Name: Icon vertical offset
Widget.Flag.Config.IconYOffset.Descripti: The vertical offset of the flag icon from the center of the widget in pixels. Positive values move the icon down, negative values move the icon up.
Widget.Flag.Config.IconLocation.Name: Icon location
Widget.Flag.Config.IconLocation.Descript: The location of the flag icon relative to the text.
Widget.Flag.Config.TextAlign.Name: Text alignment
Widget.Flag.Config.TextAlign.Description: The alignment of the flag marker widget text.
Widget.Flag.Config.TextYOffsetTop.Name: Top Text vertical offset (Map name and coordinates)
Widget.Flag.Config.TextYOffsetTop.Descri: The vertical offset of the text from the center in pixels. Positive values move the text down, negative values move the text up.
Widget.Flag.Config.TextYOffsetBottom.Nam: Bottom Text vertical offset (Nearby aetheryte and teleport cost)
Widget.Flag.Config.TextYOffsetBottom.Des: The vertical offset of the text from the center in pixels. Positive values move the text down, negative values move the text up.
Widget.Flag.Error.NoAetheryte: No nearby aetheryte found to teleport to.
Widget.UnifiedMainMenu.Name: Unified Main Menu
Widget.UnifiedMainMenu.Description: Provides quick access to all main menu items from a single widget. Also keeps track of the things you commonly use and provides quick access to them directly from the menu.
Widget.UnifiedMainMenu.Config.Label.Name: Button label
Widget.UnifiedMainMenu.Config.Label.Desc: The text that is displayed on the button.
Widget.UnifiedMainMenu.Config.IconId.Des: The icon ID that should be displayed on the button. Use the command "/xldata icons" to browse available icons to get the correct ID.
Widget.UnifiedMainMenu.Config.AvatarIcon: The icon ID that should be displayed in the header of the menu. Use the command "/xldata icons" to browse available icons to get the correct ID.
Widget.UnifiedMainMenu.Config.FixedMenuH: Sets the height of the popup menu to the given value. If the menu has more items than can fit in the given height, the menu will become scrollable.
Widget.WalkingIndicator.Name: Walking Indicator
Widget.WalkingIndicator.Description: Shows an indicator that appears when you are walking instead of running. Click the widget to toggle between walking and running.
Decorates the walking indicator widget with a background and border.
Widget.WalkingIndicator.Config.IconYOffs: The vertical offset of the walking icon from the center of the widget in pixels. Positive values move the icon down, negative values move the icon up.
Widget.WalkingIndicator.Config.OnlyShowW: Only shows the walking indicator when you are walking, and hides it when you are running.
ColorGroup.Window.Name: Window Colors
ColorGroup.Window.Description: Colors that are used for the window decorations.
ColorGroup.Input.Name: Input Controls Colors
ColorGroup.Input.Description: Colors that are used for input controls, such as buttons, checkboxes and input fields.
ColorGroup.Toolbar.Name: Toolbar Colors
ColorGroup.Toolbar.Description: Colors that are used to style the toolbar.
ColorGroup.Widget.Name: Widget Colors
ColorGroup.Widget.Description: Colors that are used to style the toolbar widgets and their popups.
ColorGroup.Role.Name: Job Roles
ColorGroup.Role.Description: Colors that are used to style the job roles in things like the gearset switcher widget.
Color.Window.Background.Name: Default background color
Color.Window.Background.Description: The default background color of a window.
Color.Window.BackgroundLight.Name: Panel background color
Color.Window.BackgroundLight.Description: The background color of panels inside a window.
Color.Window.Border.Name: Window border
Color.Window.Border.Description: The border color of a window
Color.Window.TitlebarBackground.Name: Titlebar background
Color.Window.TitlebarBackground.Descript: The background color of the window titlebar.
Color.Window.TitlebarBorder.Name: Titlebar border
Color.Window.TitlebarBorder.Description: The border color of the window titlebar.
Color.Window.TitlebarGradient1.Name: Titlebar gradient start
Color.Window.TitlebarGradient1.Descripti: The starting color of the titlebar gradient.
Color.Window.TitlebarGradient2.Name: Titlebar gradient end
Color.Window.TitlebarGradient2.Descripti: The ending color of the titlebar gradient.
Color.Window.TitlebarText.Name: Titlebar text
Color.Window.TitlebarText.Description: The color of the text on the titlebar.
Color.Window.TitlebarTextOutline.Name: Titlebar text outline
Color.Window.TitlebarTextOutline.Descrip: The outline color of the titlebar text.
Color.Window.TitlebarCloseButton.Name: Close button
Color.Window.TitlebarCloseButton.Descrip: The background color of the close button.
Color.Window.TitlebarCloseButtonBorder.D: The border color of the close button.
Color.Window.TitlebarCloseButtonHover.De: The hover color of the close button.
Color.Window.TitlebarCloseButtonX.Name: Close button X
Color.Window.TitlebarCloseButtonX.Descri: The color of the 'X' on the close button.
Color.Window.TitlebarCloseButtonXHover.D: The hover color of the 'X' on the close button.
Color.Window.TitlebarCloseButtonXOutline: The outline color of the 'X' on the close button.
Color.Window.ScrollbarTrack.Name: Scrollbar track
Color.Window.ScrollbarTrack.Description: The background color of the scrollbar track.
Color.Window.ScrollbarThumb.Name: Scrollbar thumb
Color.Window.ScrollbarThumb.Description: The color of the scrollbar thumb.
Color.Window.ScrollbarThumbHover.Name: Scrollbar thumb hover
Color.Window.ScrollbarThumbHover.Descrip: The hover color of the scrollbar thumb.
Color.Window.ScrollbarThumbActive.Name: Scrollbar thumb active
Color.Window.ScrollbarThumbActive.Descri: The active color of the scrollbar thumb.
Color.Window.Text.Name: Window text
Color.Window.Text.Description: The default text color in a window.
Color.Window.TextLight.Name: Window text light
Color.Window.TextLight.Description: A lighter color for window text.
Color.Window.TextMuted.Name: Window text muted
Color.Window.TextMuted.Description: A muted color for less prominent text.
Color.Window.TextOutline.Name: Window text outline
Color.Window.TextOutline.Description: The outline color for window text.
Color.Window.TextDisabled.Name: Window text disabled
Color.Window.TextDisabled.Description: The color of disabled text in a window.
Color.Window.AccentColor.Name: Accent color
Color.Window.AccentColor.Description: An accent color used in the window.
Color.Input.Background.Name: Input background
Color.Input.Background.Description: The background color of input fields.
Color.Input.Border.Name: Input border
Color.Input.Border.Description: The border color of input fields.
Color.Input.Text.Name: Input text
Color.Input.Text.Description: The color of text in input fields.
Color.Input.TextMuted.Name: Input text muted
Color.Input.TextMuted.Description: A muted color for input text.
Color.Input.TextOutline.Name: Input text outline
Color.Input.TextOutline.Description: The outline color for input text.
Color.Input.BackgroundHover.Name: Input background hover
Color.Input.BackgroundHover.Description: The hover background color of input fields.
Color.Input.BorderHover.Name: Input border hover
Color.Input.BorderHover.Description: The hover border color of input fields.
Color.Input.TextHover.Name: Input text hover
Color.Input.TextHover.Description: The hover color of input text.
Color.Input.TextOutlineHover.Name: Input text outline hover
Color.Input.TextOutlineHover.Description: The hover outline color of input text.
Color.Input.BackgroundDisabled.Name: Input background disabled
Color.Input.BackgroundDisabled.Descripti: The background color of disabled input fields.
Color.Input.BorderDisabled.Name: Input border disabled
Color.Input.BorderDisabled.Description: The border color of disabled input fields.
Color.Input.TextDisabled.Name: Input text disabled
Color.Input.TextDisabled.Description: The color of disabled input text.
Color.Input.TextOutlineDisabled.Name: Input text outline disabled
Color.Input.TextOutlineDisabled.Descript: The outline color of disabled input text.
Color.Toolbar.Background1.Name: Toolbar background 1
Color.Toolbar.Background1.Description: The first background color of the toolbar.
Color.Toolbar.Background2.Name: Toolbar background 2
Color.Toolbar.Background2.Description: The second background color of the toolbar.
Color.Toolbar.Border.Name: Toolbar border
Color.Toolbar.Border.Description: The border color of the toolbar.
Color.Toolbar.InactiveBackground1.Name: Toolbar inactive background 1
Color.Toolbar.InactiveBackground1.Descri: The first background color of the toolbar in an inactive state.
Color.Toolbar.InactiveBackground2.Name: Toolbar inactive background 2
Color.Toolbar.InactiveBackground2.Descri: The second background color of the toolbar in an inactive state.
Color.Toolbar.InactiveBorder.Name: Toolbar inactive border
Color.Toolbar.InactiveBorder.Description: The border color of the toolbar in an inactive state.
Color.Widget.Background.Name: Widget background
Color.Widget.BackgroundDisabled.Name: Disabled widget background
Color.Widget.BackgroundDisabled.Descript: The background color of disabled widgets.
Color.Widget.BackgroundHover.Name: Widget hover background
Color.Widget.BackgroundHover.Description: The background color of widgets when hovered.
Color.Widget.Border.Name: Widget border
Color.Widget.BorderDisabled.Name: Widget border disabled
Color.Widget.BorderDisabled.Description: The border color of disabled widgets.
Color.Widget.BorderHover.Name: Widget border hover
Color.Widget.BorderHover.Description: The hover border color of widgets.
Color.Widget.Text.Name: Widget text
Color.Widget.Text.Description: The default color of widget text.
Color.Widget.TextHover.Name: Widget text hover
Color.Widget.TextDisabled.Name: Widget text disabled

ToolbarProfilesWindow.Title: Toolbar Profiles
ToolbarProfilesWindow.ActiveProfile.Name: Active Profile
ToolbarProfilesWindow.ActiveProfile.Desc: The active profile that is currently being used for widget arrangement and settings.
ToolbarProfilesWindow.UseJobAssociatedPr: Automatically switch profiles based on your current job. Enabling this option will override the active profile selector and instead use job-specific profiles.
ToolbarProfilesWindow.CreateProfileInput: The name of the new profile. After filling in a name, click on one of the buttons below to create a profile. The new profile is activated immediately upon creation.
ToolbarProfilesWindow.DeleteProfile.Name: Profile to delete
ToolbarProfilesWindow.DeleteProfile.Desc: Delete the selected profile. This action cannot be undone. The 'Default' and currently active profiles cannot be deleted. If you delete a profile that is associated with a job, that job will revert back to the 'Default' profile.
ToolbarProfilesWindow.Notification.Expor: The profile "{0}" has been successfully exported to your clipboard and can be shared with others.
ToolbarProfilesWindow.Notification.Impor: The profile has been successfully imported from your clipboard and is now available in the profile list.
The profile could not be imported from your clipboard. Please make sure the copied data is valid and try again. Error: {0}
OOBE.Title: Umbra First-Time Setup
OOBE.DontShowAgain.Name: Don't show this window again on startup
OOBE.DontShowAgain.Description: You can always access this window from the plugin settings.
OOBE.Welcome.Title: Welcome to Umbra
OOBE.Welcome.Content.Body: Umbra is a powerful plugin that enhances your Final Fantasy XIV experience with a wide range of features and customization options. This setup wizard will guide you through the initial configuration of the plugin.
OOBE.Welcome.Content.Body2: You can always change any of these settings later in the plugin settings window, by typing "/umbra" in the chat.
OOBE.ToolbarWidgets.Title: Toolbar Setup
OOBE.ToolbarWidgets.Content.Header: Do you want a pre-configured toolbar?
OOBE.ToolbarWidgets.Content.Body: One of Umbra's main features is the toolbar, which contains a variety of customizable widgets that provide quick access to useful information and actions. You can choose to start with a pre-configured toolbar, or start fresh and leave it empty so you can customize it later.
OOBE.ToolbarWidgets.Prefill.Name: Yes, I want a pre-configured toolbar!
OOBE.ToolbarWidgets.Prefill.Description: This will add a few basic widgets to the toolbar to get you started. You can always customize it via the plugin settings window.
OOBE.ToolbarBehavior.Title: Toolbar Look & Feel
OOBE.ToolbarBehavior.Description: Let's make it act the way you want.
OOBE.ToolbarBehavior.Content.Body: Let's set up the way the toolbar positions itself and the way it behaves. You can change its appearance later in the plugin settings window.
OOBE.ToolbarBehavior.TopAligned: I want the toolbar at the top of the screen
OOBE.ToolbarBehavior.Stretched: I want the toolbar to stretch across the screen
OOBE.ToolbarBehavior.AutoHide: I want the toolbar to automatically hide itself
OOBE.Finish.Title: All set!
OOBE.Finish.Description: You're all set up and ready to go.
OOBE.Finish.Content.Body: You're all set up and ready to go. Enjoy using Umbra!
OOBE.Finish.Content.Body2: You can always access the plugin settings by typing "/umbra" in the chat. Umbra has a dedicated support channel on the XIV Launcher & Dalamud Discord server where you can ask questions and get help.
OOBE.Finish.OpenSettings.Name: Open plugin settings after closing this window
OOBE.Finish.OpenSettings.Description: This will open the plugin settings window after you hit the "Finish" button so you can further customize your Umbra experience.
